JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . By judgment of DATE ORG partitioned a property inheritance between the applicant 's mother and her relatives .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's mother gifted the applicant part of an apartment in ORG awarded to her by the above - mentioned judgment .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant 's mother instituted proceedings in ORG against GPE , GPE and CARDINAL other persons ( her relatives ) , seeking their eviction from her apartment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's mother died . On DATE the applicant was admitted to the proceedings as her next of kin .

CARDINAL . In DATE GPE and PERSON lodged a counterclaim , seeking to have the contract of CARDINAL DATE declared void ; subsequently they sought invalidation of the applicant 's mother 's will which was in favour of the applicant . They also sought to have property rights over the relevant parts of the disputed apartment acknowledged as theirs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the applicant and ordered the defendants to vacate the apartment . It dismissed the counterclaim by GPE and GPE
CARDINAL . The defendants appealed but due to the shortcomings of their appeal the proceedings were protracted for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , having found , inter alia , that the lower court had failed to examine crucial pieces of evidence , set aside that judgment and remitted the case for fresh examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation against the latter decision ; on DATE ORG dismissed her appeal .

CARDINAL . Of TIME hearings held DATE and DATE CARDINAL were adjourned due to the defendants ' failure to appear before the court . Within this period CARDINAL forensic examinations were held staying the proceedings in total for DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG took over the case .
CARDINAL . From DATE to DATE the proceedings were stayed as the additional forensic examination had been ordered .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the contract of CARDINAL DATE and the applicant 's mother 's will void . It dismissed the applicant 's request to have the defendants evicted .
CARDINAL . Of the CARDINAL hearings held by the first instance court one was adjourned due to the applicant 's and CARDINAL due to the defendants ' failure to appear before the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG and ORG of GPE dismissed the applicant 's appeals and upheld the judgment .
